Do you have a firearms void in your life, that you just can't put your finger on? Well now is your chance to lose that feeling. You have now found your next addition to your hopefully extremely manly firearms collection. I have a very nice Beretta 96 Elite II that i am looking to trade. For those of you that are unfamiliar with the Elite II variant, of the 92/96 series pistols, you have no idea what you are missing out on. Let me give you a brief rundown of why this pistol is better than a standard 92/96 and every Glock ever made. 

Cosmetics: The biggest thing is the Two Tone finish. This make the bad guys look at your gun, and realize that a man that has such a pretty gun must know what he is doing, and they better go find an Obama supporter to harass instead. The front .2 inches of the barrel have been shaved off, not only making it better balanced, but also making it not look retarded. If you have to make up with some other short comings with MASSIVE barrel length, I apologize, but i promise you will still love this pistol. The grips are factory Hogue grips. Thats right. Beretta decided they loved the Elite II customers so much that they would save them the trouble and headache of having to replace those crappy uncomfortable hard plastic Beretta grips, by doing it for you. How thoughtful, right?? The hammer is a factory skeletonized commander hammer. You know, for when things need commanding.

Parts: Ever fired a Beretta, and thought to yourself, this weapon feels like it was forged by Zeus in the bowels of Haites, but this double action trigger is heavy. and long, and not very awesome. Well Beretta decided to fix this also. A "D" spring has been installed from the DA only Beretta to lighten the pull. Ahhhh, much better. One of the biggest upgrades are the sights. Considering Beretta is the oldest gun manufacturer in the world, you would think that they would understand the benefit of night sights. Well the French got something right with the "G" variant slide (which is what is on the Elite II) and made both the front and rear sights replaceable. Good job Beretta!!! Oh did i mention that with these weapons, you also do not have to mess with that pesky, at times hard to reach, manual slide mounted safety?? Decocker only baby!! 

Magazines: I have two of them. Too bad they are the boring, lackluster 10 rounders. Beretta decided that this is what ALL Elite II models shipped with. Although you can buy 11 rounders, and then the all so intimidating 13 round extended mags. 

Holsters: I have several of them. If you like being tacticool, I have a Safariland ALS Drop Leg holster. (Don't judge me, i use it for work). but due to the "fatter" slide of the "G" slide, it doesnt really like kydex holsters, such as Blackhawk Serpa holsters. But I prefer leather anyways.
